definition: Truthful and straightforward; frank.
example: She gave a candid interview about her experiences.

definition: Fluent or persuasive in speaking or writing.
example: The politician gave an eloquent speech about social justice.

definition: Feeling or expressing great happiness and triumph.
example: The crowd was jubilant after their team won the championship.

definition: Full of or shedding light; bright or shining, especially in the dark.
example: The luminous moonlight lit up the night.

definition: Attractively unusual or old-fashioned.
example: They stayed in a quaint cottage during their vacation.

definition: Able to withstand or recover quickly from difficult conditions.
example: The human spirit is remarkably resilient.

definition: Diligent, thorough, and extremely attentive to details.
example: The accountant was scrupulous in her work, ensuring that every entry was accurate.

definition: Characterized by conflict, disorder, or confusion; not stable or calm.
example: The plane experienced turbulent conditions during the flight.

definition: Present, appearing, or found everywhere.
example: Smartphones have become ubiquitous in modern society.

definition: Playfully quaint or fanciful, especially in an appealing and amusing way.
example: The story was filled with whimsical characters and magical adventures.

definition: The action of following or chasing someone or something.
example: The police were in pursuit of the suspect.

definition: (Of an idea or opinion) formed before having the evidence for its truth.
example: She had preconceived notions about the new employee based solely on hearsay.

definition: Having or showing great enthusiasm in pursuit of a cause or objective.
example: She was a zealous supporter of the new environmental policy.

definition: Preconceived opinion that is not based on reason or actual experience.
example: The organization's goal is to reduce racial prejudice within the community.

definition: Standing out so as to be clearly visible.
example: His bright red coat made him conspicuous in the crowd.

definition: Delicious or delightful.
example: The chef prepared a delectable meal for the guests.

definition: Inspiring fear or respect through being impressively large, powerful, intense, or capable.
example: The team faced a formidable opponent in the championship game.

definition: Excessively talkative, especially on trivial matters.
example: The garrulous host entertained his guests with endless stories.

definition: In accordance with the highest standards; faultless.
example: Her impeccable manners made a lasting impression on her hosts.

definition: Having, showing, or done with good judgment or sense.
example: He made a judicious decision to invest in the new technology.

definition: A constantly changing pattern or sequence of elements.
example: The sunset turned the sky into a kaleidoscope of colors.

definition: Sumptuously rich, elaborate, or luxurious.
example: The couple hosted a lavish wedding reception for their guests.

definition: A deep, long-lasting sadness.
example: She felt a sense of melancholy wash over her as she looked at the old photographs.

definition: Wicked or criminal.
example: The villain's nefarious plans were eventually thwarted by the hero.

definition: Richly luxurious and lavish.
example: The opulent ballroom was adorned with crystal chandeliers and gold decorations.

definition: Representing the most perfect or typical example of a quality or class.
example: Paris is the quintessential city of romance.

definition: The occurrence of events by chance in a happy or beneficial way.
example: Meeting her at the coffee shop was pure serendipity.

definition: Holding firmly to something; persistent.
example: Her tenacious attitude helped her overcome many obstacles.

definition: Fully in agreement.
example: The board's decision to approve the project was unanimous.

definition: Attractively lively and animated.
example: Her vivacious personality made her the life of the party.

definition: Showing or characterized by quick and inventive verbal humor.
example: He was known for his witty remarks.

definition: A short extract from a film, broadcast, or piece of music or writing.
example: She read an excerpt from her new novel at the book launch.

definition: Look thoughtfully for a long time at; think about.
example: He stood at the edge of the cliff to contemplate the vast expanse of the ocean.

definition: In an attractive, careful way, especially used about something small or having small movements.
example: She picked up the cup daintily with her little finger extended.

definition: Anxious or fearful that something bad or unpleasant will happen.
example: She was apprehensive about the upcoming exam.

definition: Showing great attention to detail; very careful and precise.
example: He was meticulous in his work, ensuring every detail was perfect.

definition: Open to more than one interpretation; having a double meaning.
example: The wording of the contract was ambiguous, leading to different interpretations.

definition: Absolutely necessary; essential.
example: Water is indispensable for life.

definition: Wishing to do one's work or duty well and thoroughly.
example: She is a conscientious worker, always putting in her best effort.

definition: Full of energy, excitement, and cheerfulness.
example: The children were exuberant in their play.

definition: Featuring new methods; advanced and original.
example: The company is known for its innovative technology.

definition: To light up or make clear.
example: The streetlights illuminate the roads at night.

definition: Happening or doing something at the agreed or proper time; on time.
example: She is always punctual for her appointments.

definition: To make more noticeable or prominent.
example: The dress accentuates her figure perfectly.

definition: A noisy argument or disagreement, especially in public.
example: The altercation between the two drivers escalated quickly.

definition: A person who publicly supports or recommends a particular cause or policy.
example: She is an advocate for environmental protection.

definition: Given to sudden and unaccountable changes of mood or behavior.
example: Her capricious nature makes it hard to predict her reactions.

definition: To expose the falseness or hollowness of a myth, idea, or belief.
example: The scientist aimed to debunk myths about climate change.

definition: A feeling of intense longing for something.
example: She had a yearning to travel the world.

definition: A gentle, mild breeze, often associated with the west wind.
example: The zephyr that came through the open window was a welcome relief on the hot summer day.

definition: Highly skilled or proficient at something.
example: She is adept at playing the piano, having practiced diligently for years.

definition: Hostile and aggressive.
example: His belligerent attitude made it difficult to have a peaceful conversation.

definition: Having knowledge or being aware of something.
example: She was fully cognizant of the potential risks involved in the project.

definition: Having a great deal of money; wealthy.
example: The affluent neighborhood was filled with mansions and luxury cars.

definition: Having or showing zeal; fervent and enthusiastic.
example: She was a zealous supporter of the local football team.

definition: Vivacious and enthusiastic; giving off bubbles (liquid).
example: Her effervescent personality made her the life of the party.

definition: Having or showing an ability to accurately assess situations or people and turn this to one's advantage.
example: He was an astute businessman, always finding a way to maximize profits.

definition: Intelligently analytical and clear-thinking; able to express ideas and opinions clearly and directly.
example: Her incisive comments during the meeting impressed her colleagues.

definition: Fond of company; sociable.
example: His gregarious nature ensured he was always surrounded by friends.

definition: Having or showing sensitive insight.
example: Her perceptive observations revealed the true nature of the situation.

definition: So delicate or precise as to be difficult to analyze or describe.
example: The artist used subtle shades of color to convey a sense of peace.

definition: Showing or having skill, especially with the hands.
example: A dexterous guitarist can easily switch between complex chords.

definition: Lasting for a very short time.
example: The beauty of the cherry blossoms is ephemeral, lasting only a few weeks each spring.

definition: Sparing or economical with regard to money or food.
example: By being frugal and cutting unnecessary expenses, they were able to save a considerable amount of money.

definition: Acting or done quickly and without thought or care.
example: Her impetuous decision to quit her job resulted in a period of financial instability.

definition: Place or deal with close together for contrasting effect.
example: The artist juxtaposed the dark and light colors to create a striking visual effect.

definition: Characterized by bitterness or sharpness of manner, speech, or temper.
example: The debate over the new policy was acrimonious, with both sides resorting to personal attacks.

definition: Done openly and unashamedly; very obvious.
example: His blatant disregard for the rules could not be ignored.

definition: Mutual trust and friendship among people who spend a lot of time together.
example: The camaraderie among the team members was evident in their seamless coordination.

definition: To make someone or something weak or feeble.
example: The long illness had debilitated him, leaving him unable to work.

definition: Cheerful and full of energy.
example: Her ebullient personality made her a great host for the party.

definition: Very attentive to and concerned about accuracy and detail.
example: He was fastidious in his work, always double-checking every detail before submission.

definition: To shock or excite someone into taking action.
example: The urgent need for reform galvanized the community into action.

definition: Unfortunate; having bad luck.
example: The hapless traveler missed his flight and lost his luggage.

definition: A mode of behavior or way of thought peculiar to an individual.
example: One of her idiosyncrasies is always wearing mismatched socks.

definition: The fact of two things being seen or placed close together with contrasting effect.
example: The artist's use of juxtaposition highlights the contrast between the urban and the rural.
